title: Doctor Is Chronically Late
summary: A doctor arrives late several times a week. Staff complain. Address performance upward without shaming; establish leadership accountability.

scene.setting: A doctor arrives late several times a week. Staff begin complaining. You feel the authority imbalance; the hidden risk is team resentment. The decision point is avoid or schedule a candid talk.

beats.narration: The pattern is clear. The decision point is private candid conversation or public mention.

dialogue.speaker: lead
dialogue.line: I need to share the impact on the team and schedule. When can we talk privately?

choices.label: Schedule a private conversation and state the impact on the team and schedule.

steps.step: Agree one follow-up (e.g. two-week check-in or written expectation).

leader_lines: The team and schedule are affected. I need to be direct.
questions: What would help you be on time?
How do we follow up if it continues?
scripts.closing_line: Clear expectation and one follow-up date.

choices.label: Address it in a team meeting so everyone hears the standard.

steps.step: Follow up privately with the doctor; set objective expectation.

leader_lines: Standard is clear. I'll follow up with you privately.
questions: What's our follow-up if it continues?

choices.label: Avoid the conversation and try to absorb the impact yourself.

steps.step: Schedule one private conversation; frame as impact on team and patients.

leader_lines: I've been avoiding a hard conversation. I'd like to have it now.
questions: What would make this feel safe to discuss?
How do we document and involve HR if needed?

choices.label: Hint at the issue indirectly in passing.

steps.step: State behavior, impact, and expectation in one direct sentence; set follow-up.

leader_lines: I need to be direct: start time affects the team. Here's what I need.
questions: What would help you be on time?
When can we check in again?
scripts.closing_line: Direct message and one follow-up date.

system_prompts.nudge: Clear, private feedback is the first step to accountability.
system_prompts.mirror_call: Did you set the standard or avoid the conversation?

outcomes.message: Resentment has grown. The doctor may still not know the full impact.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with one private conversation?
How do you frame upward feedback as impact?

outcomes.message: Expectations are clear. Lateness improved or a support path was agreed.
reflection_questions: How do you follow up without micromanaging?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week I addressed upward performance clearly. (1-5)
